chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth P. Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:04 am - Court calls cases 15CF54 and 16CF29 and states appearances. Defendant Kenneth P. Wagner appeared telephonically from Oshkosh Correctional with attorney Megan Sanders-Drazen appearing in person.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for resentencing.  Court questions DE regarding the hearing be held by telephone.  DE agrees to appear by telephone. Atty James T Runyon called and sworn.  Direct by Atty Sanders-Drazen. Cross by DA.  Re-direct by Sanders-Drazen.  Argument by Atty Sanders-Drazen and DA.  Court will take this matter under advisement and will provide a written decision within 30 days of today.

records.addlTxt:
9:14 am - Court calls cases 15CF54 and 16CF29 and states appearances.  Defendant Kenneth P. Wagner in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA provides court with revised victim impact statement.  Statement and facts of case by DA, along with his recommendations.  Victim's mother MH gives statement.  Atty Runyon gives statement.  Summation and ruling by Court.

Court imposes:  
15CF54, Ct 1 - 35 years which consists of 20 years initial confinement, 15 years extended supervision, court costs and DNA surcharge
Ct 4 - 10 years which consists of 5 years initial confinement cc to Ct 1, 5 years extended supervision, court costs 

16CF29, Ct 1 - 5 years which consists of 2 year initial confinement cc to Ct 11, 3 years extended supervision, court costs 
Ct 11 - 3.5 years which consists of 1.5 years initial confinement on cc to Ct 1, 2 year extended supervision, court costs 

16CF29 prison time cs to 15CF54

As part of extended supervision, DE to pay $248 restitution plus $24.80 surcharge for a total of $272.80 on 15CF54
DE must complete a sex offender assessment and followup treatment and any other counseling recommended by his agent.

Court to prepare written explanation of determinate sentence

Appeal rights given.

Back on record at 9:52 am - Court goes back on record to state DE not eligible for challenge incarceration or substance abuse program.
Sentencing hearing

1:32am (15CF54 & 16CF29) Defendant Kenneth P. Wagner in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states cases and appearances.  DA recites agreement reached.  Court questions Def. regarding 16CF29.  Def. waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty. Runyon and Def. further.  Court finds preliminary hearing is waived, Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed, def. bound over for trial.  Information filed, Def. waives reading.  Def. enters plea of no contest to 16CF29-Count 1 and Count 11.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to 15CF54-Count 1 and Count 4.  Court questions def. further regarding his plea and explains elements/penalities of each charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds Def. guilty and orders judgment of conviction be entered.  On motion of DA, Court dismisses 16CF29-Count 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 &10, but read-in for purpose of plea agreement.  On motion of DA, Court dismisses 15CF54-Count 2, 3 & 5, but read-in for purpose of plea agreement.  Court orders PSI and that it be completed by 11/1/16.  Court schedules sentencing for 12/1/16 at 9:00am-11:00am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with C.M.M., DOB 3/14/03 nor any contact with any females under age 18 unless in a business or commercial setting and only for commercial or business purposes with the exception that if the individual is a family member they must be in the presence of an adult.

9:30 am - Defendant Kenneth P. Wagner in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.  On case 15CF54, DA asks that $10000 SB be revoked and replaced with $25000 CB with same conditions as original SB.  So ordered.
Motion hearing or plea and sentencing on 08-29-16 @ 1:30 pm

1:05 pm - Defendant Kenneth P. Wagner appeared with attorney James T. Runyon.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed competency evaluation. Parties stipulate that DE is competent to proceed. Exam of DE. Court finds DE competent. Set for plea and sentencing or motion hearing on 08-29-16 @ 1:30 pm. Adj. 1:13 pm.
